title: The Princess Switch 2 sequel with Vanessa Hudgens confirmed by Netflix
text:
Princess Switch 2 is coming! (Picture: Netflix)

Get ready bad Christmas movie fans, as Vanessa Hudgens is returning for a sequel to 2018’s The Princess Switch, The Princess Switch: Switched Again.

We never asked for a sequel but we’re getting one anyway.

The original film saw the High School Musical star playing the dual roles of Chicago baker Stacy DeNovo and Margaret Delacourt, Duchess of Montenaro, who, for some reason, decide to switch places after meeting at a baking competition in the fictional Kingdom of Belgravia.

Hijinks and romance obviously ensued and none of it made any sense, but we fell in love, and now the actress will return for a second installment which will follow Duchess Margaret as she ‘unexpectedly inherits the throne and hits a rough patch with Kevin so it’s up to Stacy to save the day before a new lookalike — party girl Fiona — foils their plans’.

Advertisement

Advertisement

We cannot wait.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The terrible yet oddly brilliant Netflix Christmas movie is now as festive a tradition as dry turkey and rowing with your parents over a game of Trivial Pursuit.

It started in 2017 with the baffling yet amazing A Christmas Prince.

Now two years on we’ve got not just Vanessa playing herself three times (give the girl an Oscar) but also Kiernan Shipka in Let It Snow – which looks like Love, Actually with teenagers – Holiday Rush, about which little is known, and the third film in the Christmas Prince series, A Christmas Prince: The Royal Baby.

Oh, and who can forget The Knight Before Christmas, which also stars Vanessa and which follows a medieval knight who is magically transported to the present day, and ends up falling for a science teacher.

Crack out the mince pies right this second.

description: Vanessa Hudgens will return for Netflix christmas movie The Princess Switch 2
